rev.comment: /* Statements regarding Barack Obama and backlash */
rev.diff:
Line 245: Line 245:
In the April 27 press conference, after the birth certificate was released by Obama, Trump reiterated a question raised previously whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref><ref name=Schieffer>{{cite news|author=Schieffer, Bob|title=Schieffer: Racism underlying Trump's assertions|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20058072-503544.html|date=April 27, 2011|work=CBS News|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=April 27, 2011}}</ref> Trump's statements were criticized by commentators and comedians.<ref name=Cina>{{cite news|author=Cina, Mark|title=Who Hates Donald Trump Most in Hollywood Now|date=April 29, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/who-hates-donald-trump-hollywood-183731|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Miller, Daniel|title=Donald Trump's 'Celebrity Apprentice': Why Only One Advertiser Has Fired Him (Analysis)|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-trumps-celebrity-apprentice-why-184320|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name=Schieffer/>
In the April 27 press conference, after the birth certificate was released by Obama, Trump reiterated a question raised previously whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref><ref name=Schieffer>{{cite news|author=Schieffer, Bob|title=Schieffer: Racism underlying Trump's assertions|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20058072-503544.html|date=April 27, 2011|work=CBS News|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=April 27, 2011}}</ref> Trump's statements were criticized by commentators and comedians.<ref name=Cina>{{cite news|author=Cina, Mark|title=Who Hates Donald Trump Most in Hollywood Now|date=April 29, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/who-hates-donald-trump-hollywood-183731|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Miller, Daniel|title=Donald Trump's 'Celebrity Apprentice': Why Only One Advertiser Has Fired Him (Analysis)|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-trumps-celebrity-apprentice-why-184320|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name=Schieffer/>
â
On April 6, it was announced that Trump had been replaced as the schedule driver of the pace car of the upcoming Indy 500. A Trump spokesman attributed the change to a 'scheduling conflict', while other sources attributed the change to the anti-trump protests directed towards Indy and its sponsors.
+
On April 6, it was announced that Trump had been replaced as the scheduled driver of the pace car of the upcoming Indy 500. A Trump spokesman attributed the change to a 'scheduling conflict', while other sources attributed the change to the anti-trump protests directed towards Indy and its sponsors.
